description: Epic 2: Developer Profile. First-run onboarding with opinionated recommendations produces a profile that informs all downstream decisions. Covers profile schema, onboarding interview, profile editing, and pipeline integration.

userStories.title: Profile schema and defaults
userStories.description: As a developer, I want the developer profile schema defined with sensible, opinionated defaults for every category, so that the onboarding can lead with recommendations.
acceptanceCriteria: Every field has a recommended default (e.g., PostgreSQL for database, Tailwind for styling, Zustand for state)
Schema covers: frontend framework, backend framework, database, cloud/deployment, styling, state management, analytics, CI/CD, language preferences, project structure preference (monorepo vs single)
Schema is validated with TypeScript types
Typecheck passes
All tests pass
userStories.notes: Create src/profile/schema.ts and src/profile/defaults.ts. Defaults should reflect practical, modern choices. Depends on shared types from 1.3 being complete.

userStories.title: Onboarding interview with opinionated suggestions
userStories.description: As a new user, I want Boop to walk me through a setup interview where it recommends a tech choice for each category and I can accept or override, so that my profile is generated quickly with good defaults.
acceptanceCriteria: When no ~/.boop/profile.yaml exists, Boop presents each category with a recommended choice (e.g., 'Database? PostgreSQL (recommended) â€” or type your preference:')
Pressing enter accepts the recommendation
Typing a different answer overrides it
The interview completes in under 3 minutes for users accepting all defaults
~/.boop/profile.yaml is generated and saved
Typecheck passes
All tests pass
userStories.notes: Create src/profile/onboarding.ts. Use interactive CLI prompts (@clack/prompts is already installed from Epic 1). Lead with opinion, allow override. Replace the onboarding stub from Story 1.5. Depends on 2.1 and 1.5 being complete.

userStories.title: Profile editing
userStories.description: As a user, I want to edit my developer profile after initial setup, so that I can update preferences as my stack evolves.
acceptanceCriteria: Running npx boop --profile when profile.yaml exists re-runs the onboarding interview with current values shown as defaults
User can accept current values or change them
Updated profile is saved
Typecheck passes
All tests pass
userStories.notes: Re-use onboarding flow from 2.2, pre-populate with current profile values. Wire into the --profile CLI flag from Story 1.2. Depends on 2.2 being complete.

userStories.title: Profile integration with pipeline
userStories.description: As a developer, I want the pipeline to load and use the developer profile when making decisions, so that planning and scaffolding reflect my preferences automatically.
acceptanceCriteria: Profile is loaded from ~/.boop/profile.yaml and available to all pipeline phases
Planning prompts receive profile context (tech stack, patterns, preferences)
If no profile exists, Boop refuses to start and triggers onboarding
Typecheck passes
All tests pass
userStories.notes: Profile loaded in src/pipeline/orchestrator.ts and passed to all phase functions. Add profile parameter to PipelineOrchestrator constructor or phase methods. Depends on 2.2 and 1.4 being complete.
